paragraphs.text: You get to decide. You must decide — because if you don’t, someone else will. Indecision is a bad decision.

paragraphs.name: 90d0
paragraphs.text: As Professor Harold Hill has said — “You pile up enough tomorrows, and you’llfind you are left with nothing but a lot of empty yesterdays.”
The rest of this blog post is worthless if you don’t make sleep a priority. Who cares if you wake up at 5 o’clock A.M. if you went to bed three hours earlier?
paragraphs.name: 9b42

paragraphs.text: Ordinary people seek entertainment. Extraordinary people seek education and learning. It is common for the world’s most successful people to read at least one book per week. They are constantly learning.
paragraphs.name: 7fc6
f998
paragraphs.text: It was social and cultural to live our lives on other people’s terms just one generation ago. And many millennials are perpetuating this process simply because it’s the only worldview we’ve been taught.
Your goals should be written down — short term and long term. Taking just a few minutes to read your life vision puts your day into perspective.

paragraphs.name: b92c
paragraphs.text: You may use stimulants to compensate, but that isn’t sustainable. In the long-run, your health will fall apart. The goal needs to be long-term sustainability.

paragraphs.text: As for me, I need my cup of coffee as soon as I wake up since my spirit animal in the morning is the sloth. Yikes! But thank you for writing this, very informative especially the protein breakfast and long term and short term tips. Props mate

content.subtitle: Also we don’t need to follow the 8 steps in order do we? Except number 1 I guess!

paragraphs.text: Great opening sentence. Exactly my dilemma, but two months ago started to get up earlier to get things done, breakfast, workout, motivation all before work. And hey presto, it’s slowly working, the benefits are showing especially solving tiredness and getting things done. Still a long way to go but there’s always tomorrow!
